raw_text:
Yelling takes Cardiff hat-trick
 
 European cross-country champion Hayley Yelling completed a hat-trick of wins in the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge in Bute Park on Sunday afternoon.
 
 The part-time maths teacher beat Irish international Jolene Byrne by 40 metres in the six-kilometre race. Another Great Britain international, Louise Damen, finished third as part of the contingent representing England. Peter Riley, who secured bronze for the GB men's team at last month's European Championships, won the men's 9km race. Riley, representing England, moved away over the last two kilometres to win by 25 metres from Ireland's Gary Murray. Glynn Tromans - the reigning UK Inter-Countries and England Cross-Country champion - came in third place as he continues his comeback from a five-month injury lay-off.
llama3.2:1b: Hayley Yelling completed a hat-trick of wins in the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge, beating Jolene Byrne by 40 meters in the six-kilometre race and securing bronze for England's men's team at last month's European Championships.
llama3.2:3b: Hayley Yelling won three titles at the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge, beating Jolene Byrne by 40 meters in the six-kilometer race. Peter Riley won the men's 9km race, with Gary Murray finishing second.
gemma2:2b: Hayley Yelling won the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge with a hat trick of wins, while Peter Riley won the men's 9km race for England.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Here is the summary of the text:

The Welsh cross-country athlete Hayley Yelling scored three goals during the Cardiff Challenge, beating Irish international Jolene Byrne, Great Britain's Louise Damen and English team player Peter Riley to win the race. Glynn Tromans, who won the men's 9km race, also made the final.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Yelling completed a hat-trick of victories in the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge, winning 40 meters ahead of Jolene Byrne and finishing behind Louise Damen for the GB contingent. Peter Riley secured bronze for GB men's team at last month's European Championships, beating Ireland's Gary Murray by 25 meters over the final two kilometers. Glynn Tromans came in third place as he recovers from a five-month injury lay-off.
qwen2.5:3b: Hayley Yelling won a hat-trick of races at the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge: six-kilometre women's race, nine-kilometre men's race, and UK Inter-Countries/Cross-Country championships title. In the women's race, she beat Jolene Byrne by 40 metres; Louise Damen was third. Peter Riley won the men's race with a 25-metre victory over Gary Murray. Glynn Tromans came in third place after his injury lay-off.

Hayley Yelling was a European cross-country champion who completed a hat-trick of wins in the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge, showcasing her consistent performance. Peter Riley, representing England, won his 9-kilometre men's race and continued his recovery after a five-month lay-off.
tinyllama:1.1b: Apart from Hayley Yelling, who completed a hat-trio of wins in the Reebok Cardiff Cross Challenge on Sunday at Bute Park, participants won their respective races with no interruptions or injuries. English athletes took part in the event, with the top three finishers being selected by the Great Britain team for the upcoming European Championships. Peter Riley claimed bronze, with Gary Murray and Glynn Tromans finishing third and fourth respectively.

She was followed by Louise Damen from Great Britain and Peter Riley from England who secured bronze in the men's 9km race with a time of 25 meters. Glynn Tromans from the UK came in third place as he continues his comeback from an injury lay-off.
